text: Gram Positive Staining on a bacteria from the order Lactobacillus. Lactobacillus thermophilus is a gram-positive, non-motile, non sporing rod shaped bacteria. It belongs to the unclassified Bacillus genus. The heterotypic synonym for this genus is the Staphylococcus. Found mostly in pasteurized milk, the bacteria is reported to grow optimally from 50 °C to 60 °C. The bacteria is a facultative anaerobe and has shown the ability to create acid using numerous sugars and alcohols. Most of the lactic acid produced by the organism is d-lactic acid, however studies have shown the production of L-Lactic Acid. == References == Category:Lactobacillaceae
title: Lactobacillus thermophilus
